cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 175 miles SSE of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest through the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and tracking along/just offshore the U.S. East Coast toward the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina/North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches currently confined to portions of the Florida east coast (Hallandale Beach to Flagler/Volusia County Line)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm warnings in the Central & Northwestern Bahamas and Boca Raton FL to Volusia/Brevard County Line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida through New England, including the Mid-Atlantic shoreline
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (isolated totals to 6" forecast for Mid-Atlantic)
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty conditions possible late 4 Aug
weather_observation.storm_surge: No specific storm-surge guidance issued for upper Chesapeake Bay yet; minor water-level rises (<3 ft) cannot be ruled out if track shifts west
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches likely with localized 4–6 inches, producing risk of flash/urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rainbands, hazardous seas in approaches to Chesapeake Bay
